description:
This is a year round internship.
  

  
This internship is designed to give you real life work experience as a PC Support Technician.  You will work alongside experienced IT professionals.  You will:
  

  
Provide first level technical support for back office users. First level technical support may include, but not be limited to, the following: utilizing windows deployment for workstations and installing the required software, installing workstations in the back office and branches, racking servers, moving computer equipment, performing routine hardware and software upgrades, and first level troubleshooting.
  

  
Receive professional training and mentoring that will lead to transferable work experience.
  

  
Work in a supportive, team oriented environment.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
•Completion of 1 year of college/technical school to include classes in Windows operating systems, PC repair, and networking. Will consider commensurate experience.
  

  
•A working knowledge of Ethernet, TCP/IP, and Active Directory.
  

  
•A strong commitment to customer service.
  

  
•Occasional overtime may be necessary to accomplish group goals.
  

  
•Good organizational skills and the ability to multi-task.
  

  
•Ability to lift 25 pounds.
  

  
•Ability to deal effectively with end-users, peers and managers in written as well as oral communications.
  

  
•Willingness to accept duties as assigned.
  
**Address:**  Liberty Commons Building
  
**Employment Status:**  Intern
  
**FLSA:**  Non-Exempt
  
**Schedule Information:**  Monday through Friday, approximately 25-30 hours per week
  
**Benefits Information:**  Full-time employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with immediate vesting, tuition reimbursement, and gym membership reimbursement.
  
Part-time employees qualify for 401(k) with immediate vesting, tuition reimbursement, and gym reimbursement.
  

  
For more information, please visit  http://www.dollarbank.com/careers/training_and_benefits.aspx .
  
**EEO Statement:**  Dollar Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
Dollar Bank is currently seeking a Part Time Teller for its Strongsville Branch.
  

  
DUTIES:
  

  
• Process transactions through the teller equipment on all retail and corporate accounts, including, but not limited to, deposits, withdrawals, transfers, loan payments, and cash advances.
  
• Issue money orders, cashier checks, gift cards, and savings bonds.
  
• Initiate conversations to uncover customer needs and promote Dollar Bank products and services, and effectively refer customers to appropriate team members when needed.
  
• Act with confidence by helping customers with their questions, and take initiative and use sound judgment in decision-making and problem resolution.
  
• Promote good customer relations by consistently providing quality service with a friendly demeanor, can-do attitude, and willingness to help at all times.
  
• Maintain a position of trust and responsibility by keeping all customer information confidential.
  
• Continuously increase skills and knowledge of bank products and guidelines through self-motivation and in-house training.
  
• Maintain a professional appearance and manner at all times.
  
• Successfully complete teller assessment.
  
• Maintain an acceptable balancing record.
  
• Complete additional duties as assigned.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
• High school diploma or GED required.
  
• Six months customer service or cash handling experience required.  Previous teller experience preferred.
  
• Must be a team player, flexible and lead by example.
  
• Must be a highly motivated self-starter.
  
• Excellent interpersonal skills and professional manner.
  
• Ability to work between 20-25 hours per week with the ability to work full time hours for approximately 2-3 weeks during initial training period.
  
• Ability to lift a minimum of 3-5 pounds of heavy coin required.
  
• Ability to stand on feet for long periods of time required.
  
• Professional communication skills and appearance are required.
  
• Proficient computer skills required.
  
• Math aptitude required.
  
• Must not have a negative unresolved personal financial history with Dollar Bank.

description:
The Customer Service Center Representative (Sales) is responsible for the sales of Dollar Bank’s products and services to meet customer expectations and departmental objectives. •Maintain a solid understanding of Dollar Bank retail products and services.
  
•Engage in proactive conversations with customers and prospects in the Pittsburgh and Cleveland market areas to gain insight and knowledge regarding their banking needs.
  
•Sell and open various types of retail deposit and asset accounts (checking, savings, loans and CD’s).
  
•Utilize professional customer service techniques when servicing customers and when resolving customer concerns.  Act as a liaison to other departments in solving customer concerns.

•Financial institution and/or call center experience a plus.
  
•Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  
•Ability to assess customer needs and respond to them accordingly.
  
•Ability to diplomatically handle difficult customer situations and respond to them accordingly.
  
•Ability to learn Dollar Bank retail products/ services, regulations, policies and procedures.
  
•Excellent computer, internet and technical skills.
  
•Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  
•Ability to adapt to a changing work environment.
  
•Excellent organizational and time management skills.

title: Call Center Representative (Sales)

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
As a Customer Service Specialist, you will be responsible for identifying our customers’ financial needs by providing a thorough analysis and recommending the most appropriate Dollar Bank products and services to fulfill those needs. You will use your customer service experience, product knowledge and positive demeanor to initiate, expand and retain customer relationships through customer conversations and outbound calling.  We are looking for flexible, enthusiastic, hardworking individuals with a sincere appreciation for people and an empathetic communication style to proactively contribute to the branch sales and service goals.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
In a typical banking day you will enjoy a high level of customer contact.  The primary focus of this role includes:
  
• Providing quality customer service in a positive, courteous and enthusiastic manner to all internal and external customers
  
• Contributing to the growth and retention of deposit and loan customers. Demonstrating a proactive sales approach to building customer relationships, effectively utilizing the customer conversations to promote Dollar Bank products and services and meeting the established Relationship Building goals set by your management team.
  
• Performing teller functions based upon the needs of the branch. Maintaining an acceptable balancing record while processing transactions in an accurate and efficient manner.
  
• Adhering to all established branch operational processes and procedures.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
  
• High school diploma/GED required.
  
• College degree required, or a minimum of 1 year demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service in financial services or retail industry.
  
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to include professional grammar and demeanor.
  
• Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and Saturdays.
  
• Ability to travel as needed to training.
  
• Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks, and obtaining a unique identifier by the NMLS.
  
**Address:**  Waterworks Mall
  
**Employment Status:**  Full-time
  
**FLSA:**  Non-Exempt
  
**Schedule Information:**  This branch is open Monday through Friday 8:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and Saturday 8:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

title: Part-time Teller Trainee, Crafton

description:
Hours:  Monday through Friday, 11:45AM-8:00PM
  

  
JOB FUNCTION/PURPOSE:
  

  
The purpose of the position is to execute all collection activity for the consumer loan, credit card, and/or DDA chargeoff portfolio(s).  This individual will collect delinquent accounts via telephone and mail while maintaining compliance with the Fair Debt Collection Practice Act.
  

  
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  

  
•Makes calls (inbound and outbound) to negotiate payment arrangements with customers.
  
•Maintains thorough follow-up and documentation of accounts via multiple software systems.
  
•Counsels customers to establish repayment plans and/or negotiate settlements.
  
•Conducts online searches and contacts. references to obtain customer information (“Skip Tracing”).
  
•Prepares extensive paperwork for bankruptcy proofs-of-claim, litigation, and charge-offs.
  
•Performs related administrative duties necessary to service and/or collect the account.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
•Bachelor’s Degree, or High School Diploma and 1 year of collection experience, is required.
  
•Good organization, communication, customer service, and phone skills essential.
  
•Independent, goal-oriented, problem-solving approach to collections.
  
•Demonstrated aptitude for persuasive speaking and negotiation skills via telephone.
  
•Detail-oriented; able to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic work environment.
  
•Collection industry experience preferred, including skip-tracing and pre-legal preparation.
  
**Address:**  Liberty Commons Building
  
**Employment Status:**  Full-time

title: Collector

description:
Hours of this position are Monday through Friday 1:00 PM to 9:15 PM
  

  
As a ACH Processor you will be a member of Dollar Bank’s Automated Clearing House Operations team. The purpose of this position is to facilitate the receipt and origination of ACH transactions for Dollar Bank retail and corporate customers. Candidates will perform multiple job functions related to the processing of ACH transactions. You will use your research skills and risk avoidance skills to accurately and efficiently insure that files are processed within established guidelines and meet critical deadlines.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
•Process incoming and outgoing ACH files.
  
•Monitor established ACH risk controls.
  
•Provide statistical reporting to management.
  
•Possess a thorough knowledge and understanding of the ACHplus software package.
  
•Process new client set-up in ACHplus.
  
•Balance with Federal Reserve, Accounting, and internal General Ledger system on a daily basis.
  
•Research and answer customer inquiries.
  
•Process non-complex reclamations from Federal Government Agencies and other originators within appropriate time frames.
  
•Insure daily functions are completed accurately and within the deadlines of the department.
  
•Complete additional duties as assigned.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
•High School Diploma/GED required.
  
•Banking experience is preferred.
  
•Working knowledge of ACH is preferred, including good balancing skills and an understanding of debit and credit transactions.
  
•Ability to demonstrate good problem solving and technical skills, attention to details as well as a good math aptitude.
  
•Must be a highly motivated self-starter, a team player, flexible, and lead by example.
  
•Working knowledge of MS Excel and Word with the ability to learn additional applications and maneuver between them.
  
•Must possess good written and verbal communication skills.
  
•Strong customer service skills.
  
•Ability to move large sums of money within established policies and operating procedures.
  
•Must be willing to learn State and Federal Regulations, including but not limited to Regulation J, Regulation E, UCC Law, OFAC and NACHA.
  
•Must be willing to learn NACHA (National Automated Clearing House Association) rules regarding credit and debit processing requirements.
  
•Must be willing to begin studying and passing the National Automated Clearing House Association Accredited ACH Professional Certification test.
  
**Address:**  Liberty Commons Building

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
As a Customer Service Specialist, you will be responsible for identifying our customers’ financial needs by providing a thorough analysis and recommending the most appropriate Dollar Bank products and services to fulfill those needs. You will use your customer service experience, product knowledge and positive demeanor to initiate, expand and retain customer relationships through customer conversations and outbound calling.  We are looking for flexible, enthusiastic, hardworking individuals with a sincere appreciation for people and an empathetic communication style to proactively contribute to the branch sales and service goals.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
In a typical banking day you will enjoy a high level of customer contact.  The primary focus of this role includes:
  
• Providing quality customer service in a positive, courteous and enthusiastic manner to all internal and external customers
  
• Contributing to the growth and retention of deposit and loan customers. Demonstrating a proactive sales approach to building customer relationships, effectively utilizing the customer conversations to promote Dollar Bank products and services and meeting the established Relationship Building goals set by your management team.
  
• Performing teller functions based upon the needs of the branch. Maintaining an acceptable balancing record while processing transactions in an accurate and efficient manner.
  
• Adhering to all established branch operational processes and procedures.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
  
• High school diploma/GED required.
  
• College degree required, or a minimum of 1 year demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service in financial services or retail industry.
  
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to include professional grammar and demeanor.
  
• Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and Saturdays.

• Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks, and obtaining a unique identifier by the NMLS.

description:
We are looking for enthusiastic, hardworking individuals with a sincere appreciation for people and an empathetic communication style that can assume a leadership role, motivate and hold accountable the team members of a branch to achieve all relationship building, operational integrity and customer service goals. As an Assistant Branch Manager, you will work with the Branch Manager in building a motivated, customer service focused team where everyone contributes to the success of the branch. You will lead the team by example and challenge them to exceed their expectations. This is a management position where the incumbent will participate in a six to nine month comprehensive retail banking training program.
  

  
Description of Duties: In a typical banking day you will enjoy a high level of customer contact. The primary focus of this role includes:
  
•Directly impacting the growth and retention of deposit and loan customers. Leading the branch in fostering a proactive approach to building customer relationships while always maintaining the highest level of professionalism, integrity and ethics.
  
•Providing quality customer service and placing an emphasis on increasing the proactive sales and service efforts of team members through individual coaching sessions and team meetings. It is important that the Assistant Branch Manager create an enthusiastic, energetic and positive work environment for the team to flourish.
  
•Upholding the operational integrity of the branch by assisting the team in all areas of branch operations and demonstrating sound decision making skills as it relates to risk, profitability and customer service.
  

  
Qualifications: The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
  
• Bachelor degree required. Will consider commensurate experience.
  
• Retail banking experience preferred.
  
• Managerial or leadership experience is required.
  
• A minimum of one to three years customer service experience including demonstrated ability to achieve sales goals and deliver outstanding customer service is required.
  
• Must be able to travel to branches with varied evening and weekend hours.
  
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to include professional grammar and demeanor.
  
• Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and Saturdays.
  
• A valid Driver's license and access to a reliable vehicle is required. Ability to travel as needed to training.
  
• Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks, and obtaining a unique identifier by the NMLS.

title: Assistant Branch Manager, University Heights

description:
Vice President of Treasury Management will be responsible for selling treasury management services to businesses and government entities. These transactions are generally more complex in structure than standard services. Most sales activities will be conducted in-person at the client/prospect’s business. Incumbent must have a thorough understanding of the dynamics of the banking/finance environment as well as a focused strategy that supports a client needs based sales process. This is critical to grow the portfolio and provide a level of client service that exceeds client expectations.
  

  
Qualifications:
  
•A thorough knowledge of cash management/deposit products and services.
  
• Minimum of ten (10) years banking experience to include cash management.
  
• Certified Treasury Professional (CTP) Certification strongly preferred.
  
•Bachelor’s degree preferred.
  
•Must have strong communication skills, both oral and written, with a minimum of seven (7) years’ experience in responding to Request for Proposals (RFPs).
  
• Strong analytical skills with a thorough knowledge of the mathematics of treasury management, including account analysis.
  
•Ability to work independently and exercise good judgment.
  
•Ability to focus on the client/prospect; uncover and meet underlying needs, follow through on questions, requests and concerns; approaches each interaction as an opportunity.
  
•Contagious passion for clients and their businesses.
  
•Proficient knowledge of IBM/PC, Windows and Microsoft Office.
  
•Knowledge of banking systems and branch operations.
  
•Maintain effective relationships with management, fellow employees and business partners while fostering a spirit of teamwork.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  
•Engage in business development efforts that include enhancing existing relationships and developing new relationships primarily through in-person visits. (Clients and prospects will generally be larger and more sophisticated than those normally associated with the branch network).
  
•Develop and manage internal partnerships with internal customers: Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Private Banking and Business Banking to assist them with calling efforts and sell treasury management services to borrowing clients of the Bank.
  
•Act as a reference for internal/partner inquiries about the Bank’s treasury management services without reliance on Product Management for information.
  
•Cultivate and develop relationships with referral sources regarding Dollar Bank’s philosophy and our team approach to relationship building.
  
•Act as a liaison for the various assets divisions and Treasury Management Product for training and new product development needs.
  
•Respond to and resolve client inquiries and issues with the help of the Treasury Management Team.
  
•Ability to effectively lead a meeting and/or project assignment.
  
**Address:**  501 S. Independence Blvd
  
**Employment Status:**  Full-time
  
**FLSA:**  Exempt
  
**Schedule Information:**  Core hours from 8am - 5pm.  Flexible to meet customers and participate in after hour events.
  
**Benefits Information:**  Full-time employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with immediate vesting, tuition reimbursement, and gym membership reimbursement.
  
Part-time employees qualify for 401(k) with immediate vesting, tuition reimbursement, and gym reimbursement.
  

  
For more information, please visit  http://www.dollarbank.com/careers/training_and_benefits.aspx .

title: Branch Manager

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
Digital is a rapidly growing and critical area at Dollar Bank.  The VP of Digital Product Management will be responsible for helping to plan, create, and execute the digital strategy across the bank’s lines of business.  This person will create and manage the roadmaps for all digital platforms (mobile & online) and lead all components of the product life cycle for digital platforms, services, and features.  Responsibilities also include working with the marketing, technology, customer service, legal, accounting, risk, and other areas of the bank to ensure clear communications and timely issue resolution to deliver continual improvement for our digital efforts.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Technology, or a related discipline required;
  
• 8-10+ years of product management experience in the digital/mobile space including developing and delivering on digital/mobile strategy initiatives.
  
• Demonstrated experience in an online product management role driving the development and implementation of online strategies.
  
• Proven ability to develop product roadmaps, define requirements and lead implementation efforts successfully.
  
• Demonstrated experience guiding online/mobile user design experiences.
  
• Demonstrated experience managing complex projects.
  
• Superior quantitative and analytical skills, critical thinking, and ability to synthesize data and draw conclusions.
  
• Demonstrated communications, interpersonal, and relationship management skills; ability to work well as part of a cross-functional team and lead across the organization at multiple levels.
  
• Ability to influence diverse, cross functional team to success without direct authority over the team.
  
• Excellent verbal, writing and presentation skills.
  
• Passion for customers and a demonstrated focus on customer experience.
  
• Personal computer skills – particularly Microsoft Office programs – and the demonstrated ability to quickly learn new software/systems.
  
• Strong thought leadership required to manage the development and growth of products.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
• Manage overall customer experience for the digital products and services assigned and provide strategic direction and drive enhancements via 1-3 yr roadmaps.
  
• Develop strategic roadmap based on in-depth understanding of (1) voice of the customer; (2) competitive analysis; (3) profitability; (4) product life cycle; and (5) vendor/platform capabilities.
  
• Partner with retail and business banking teams to create and use digital assets to help the businesses achieve their objectives.
  
• Work with project managers to oversee a portfolio of projects to provide for the digital needs of customers and prospective customers.
  
• Develop and manage annual Key Performance Indicators for assigned digital products and provide monthly digital scorecard and analysis that tracks results monthly for adoption and growth.
  
• Partner with Marketing for adoption & acquisition support, product positioning, promotion of digital products and services and onboarding activities.
  
• Act as the SME to understand all aspects of the internal and external environment including customer met/unmet digital needs through research efforts, in-depth understanding of voice of the customer, industry trends, vendor/platform capabilities and best practices for servicing the digital needs of our customers.
  
• Continuously assess & report on competitive moves and monitor digital platform performance against objectives.
  
• Develop business cases and perform cost/benefit analysis as needed to secure funding for enhancements and initiatives.
  
• Present data, strategies and recommendations to senior management to build buy-in to strategic recommendations including new services, updates to existing services, and retiring existing services.
  
• Prioritize product requirements and coordinate release plans with IT and key constituents.
  
• Act as the Chair person for the cross functional Internet Committee.
  
• Serve as primary business point of contact & decision maker for implementation activities and work closely across key constituents to meet scheduled milestones.
  
• Document high level descriptions and detailed business requirements to enable resource estimates from technology and QA teams.

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
The Staff auditor performs assigned tasks and prepares supporting schedules and work papers as part of an audit team when examining and evaluating the adequacy and effectiveness of the system of controls.  The information gathered by the auditors and their findings are communicated to management in a timely and reliable manner to assist management in evaluating and furthering the quality and efficiency of its operations.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
•Assists and/or conducts audits of assigned departments and/or branch offices to evaluate the adequacy, effectiveness and efficiency of the internal control system, and to determine compliance with established bank policies, procedures, government regulations and industry best practices.
  
•Performs audit program steps for assigned audits under the direction of an in-charge auditor.
  
•Determines compliance with policies and procedures.
  
•Documents an understanding of policies, procedures and the internal control system.
  
•Documents audit testing in a concise manner through preparation of detailed audit work papers prepared in accordance with departmental standards.
  
•Provides clear explanations of audit procedures performed in audit work papers.
  
•Prepares conclusions on the system on internal control based upon the results of the work performed.
  
•Presents any irregularities to in-charge auditor along with the proposed disposition.
  
•Documents exceptions to bank policies and procedures and internal control weaknesses.
  
•Assists external auditors with their annual review.
  
•Performs special projects and assignments under direction of department management.
  
•Evaluates procedures while completing the audit to determine the existence of any possible recommendations for improved efficiency.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
•B.A. or B.S. in Accounting or business related degree required.  Audit experience strongly preferred.
  
•Proficiency in applying internal auditing standards, procedures and techniques while performing internal audits.
  
•Proficiency in accounting principals and techniques is required of auditors who work with the bank’s financial records and reports.
  
•An understanding of internal control principles is required to be able to recognize and evaluate deviations during the course of an audit.
  
•An understanding of computer concepts and controls is required.
  
•Proficiency in the use of a computer (MS Word, Excel).
  
•Good writing skills in order to prepare well-documented work papers and draft audit exception items as a basis for the formal audit report to management.
  
•Ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing with customers and bank employees.

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
The Treasury Management Sales Support Admin. is responsible for assisting Treasury Management (TM) sales representatives with development of TM business. Primary responsibilities include coordination and support of client product implementations, daily customer service needs, complex service issues, and continuous support.  This position services as the liaison between TM and the customer for all phone calls, issues, concerns, operational needs and general “online systems support”.   This role also provides training to customers on features and functions of services and products coupled with general administrative assistance to TM Sales Officers with the coordination of sales of TM products.
  

  
The TM Sales Support Admin. is also responsible for development of automated and manual risk reporting routines for specified products.  This role will be required to advise TM representatives and management of potential risks based upon technical knowledge and best practices.
  

  
PRINCIPLE DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
  
•Provide general customer support for TM Sales Officers; process customer requests for assistance with treasury management products and services; research inquiries regarding overdrafts, transfers, service charges, and account performance.
  
•Analyze risk review process as assigned for ACH, Wire Transfer, Remote Deposit or Funds Availability as required.
  
•Analyze and monitor specific assigned risk functions for ACH, Wire Transfer, Remote Deposit or Funds Availability as required for any designated customer.
  
•Implement sold TM services:
  
o Opening new accounts, order checks, endorsement stamps as needed.
  
o Preparing and mail welcome packets.
  
o Completing documentation (regulatory and internal) to successfully implement all sold products and services (service agreements/riders).
  
•Implement new business set-up of TM products and services including pre/post sale customer documentation.
  
•Sustain an ongoing understanding of TM products and services; keep abreast of regulatory and policy changes affecting TM to ensure compliance.
  
•Consistently address and manage escalated client issues.
  
•Initiate updates to procedure manual as needed.
  
•Maintain ongoing communication with internal and external customers for the successful implementation of TM services and account maintenance.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  
•College degree or banking/admin. experience required.
  
•Knowledge of banking depository, cash management products, banking systems and branch operations recommended.
  
•Strong analytical skills; ability to navigate systems, access data, reconcile numbers, identify discrepancies and understand drivers of change within data.
  
•Effective oral and written communications.
  
•Ability to resolve escalated client issues and proactively diffuse conflict.
  
•Proficient in MS Office, specifically Word (Candidate will be tested).

• Must have at least two years of extensive personal computer experience and at least two years of network experience.
  
• This network experience should include but not be limited to installing and trouble-shooting network hardware/software, as well as training and supporting users in a Windows/Ethernet environment.
  
• Must have a fundamental knowledge of computers and operating systems.
  
• Fundamental experience with desktop troubleshooting and resolving printer and multifunction device issues.
  
• A strong knowledge of networking protocols, especially TCP/IP is also required.
  
• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  
• Willingness to learn and keep abreast of new skills and techniques.

Responsible for tracking key project milestones and adjusting project plans and/or resources to meet the needs of customers.

description:
The Senior Commercial Real Estate Underwriter will be primarily responsible for analyzing and preparing credit proposals for new and existing commercial real estate relationships. The job function will also include the monitoring of Borrower’s financial performance to assist in the risk rating process. In addition, the Senior Commercial Real Estate Underwriter will assist in the preparation of monthly reports, perform ongoing portfolio analysis and complete other duties as assigned.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
•  Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field, will consider commensurate experience.
  
•  Minimum 2 years work experience in analysis/underwriting of commercial loans.
  
•  Excellent oral and written communication skills in addition to strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
  
•  Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, independently and achieve required objectives with limited supervision.
  
•  Ability to work within a team environment, interacting with peers and management within the bank, as well as, with customers and outside support (appraisers, attorneys, accountants, etc.).
  
•  Experience with real estate software a plus.
  
•  Experience in an appraisal related field a plus.
  
•  PA Real Estate License a plus.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
•  Perform underwriting of new and existing commercial real estate loans to assess the financial condition, repayment capacity and risks associated with the transaction. To include analysis of real estate cash flow, global cash flows, personal cash flow and personal financial statements.
  
•  Review and analyze loan documents, leases, sales agreements, appraisals and other related materials. Effectively communicate results of the underwriting in a written loan presentation for review by lenders and senior management.
  
•  May participate in on-site client meetings.
  
•  Assure all analysis and underwriting conforms to credit policy, banking regulations and commercial real estate underwriting policies.
  
•  Research data to obtain information regarding current and projected status of certain industries, borrowers and market trends to assist in determining its impact on both the real estate and banking industry.
  
•  Prepare monthly credit and portfolio loan reports.
  
•  Mentor and assist in training of less experienced commercial real estate underwriters.
  
•  Perform additional assignments as requested.

Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled
title: Project Analyst

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
The VP, Real Estate Lending and Services is responsible for generating, underwriting and managing a medium size portfolio of commercial real estate loans. This individual will provide quality customer service and satisfaction while at the same time meeting a high level of credit quality consistent with the objectives of the Bank. This will be reflected in the accuracy, reliability, creativity, and consistency shown in analyzing, servicing and managing portfolios while effectively providing structural alternatives to customer loan requests.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• A Bachelor’s Degree in Business or a related field is required. Will consider commensurate experience. MBA preferred.
  
• Must have at least 5 years of experience in Commercial Real Estate Lending including negotiating loans, analyzing data, and providing exceptional customer service.
  
• Must have excellent math and analytical skills.
  
• Ability to make independent and sound decisions.
  
• Ability to work with and provide leadership to department employees.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Solicit and negotiate loan applications for commercial mortgage loans through owners and developers of commercial real estate and residential development.
  
• Obtain and analyze pertinent financial, credit and market data to determine the borrowers/guarantors credit worthiness and recommend terms and conditions of loan structure for borrower.
  
• Perform site inspections of perspective property and market area to ensure stability and integrity of the property.
  
• Prepare loan presentations for all appropriate committee approvals, which includes working with loan analysts and underwriting.
  
• Ensure that appraisal, flood certifications and other required documents are ordered prior to funding.
  
• Work with outside legal counsel to complete the real estate closing process by ensuring the proper preparation of required legal documents. Participate in closings of loans to ensure bank’s approval is documented to the agreed upon structure of the loan.
  
• Manage, daily, all customer relationships assigned by Bank. Includes monitoring other Bank related services within these relationships.
  
• Read trade publications, business newspapers, and economic forecasts and participate in appropriate trade organizations in order to develop an awareness of economic activity, current events and local ongoing activities in the real estate industry. Evaluate this market information as to its impact on real estate and banking industry.
  
• Perform additional assignments as requested.
  

  
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
  
Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). See, hear, talk and perform tasks requiring manual dexterity and visual acuity; sit, stand, walk, crouch,  reach, pull, push and other similar, repetitive tasks requiring physical activity. Able to operate standard office/computer equipment such as photocopiers, fax machines, computers, iPads, scanners, calculators, etc.
  

  
Note:
  
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

title: Branch Manager

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
As a Customer Service Specialist, you will be responsible for identifying our customers’ financial needs by providing a thorough analysis and recommending the most appropriate Dollar Bank products and services to fulfill those needs. You will use your customer service experience, product knowledge and positive demeanor to initiate, expand and retain customer relationships through customer conversations and outbound calling.  We are looking for flexible, enthusiastic, hardworking individuals with a sincere appreciation for people and an empathetic communication style to proactively contribute to the branch sales and service goals.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
In a typical banking day you will enjoy a high level of customer contact.  The primary focus of this role includes:
  
• Providing quality customer service in a positive, courteous and enthusiastic manner to all internal and external customers
  
• Contributing to the growth and retention of deposit and loan customers. Demonstrating a proactive sales approach to building customer relationships, effectively utilizing the customer conversations to promote Dollar Bank products and services and meeting the established Relationship Building goals set by your management team.
  
• Performing teller functions based upon the needs of the branch. Maintaining an acceptable balancing record while processing transactions in an accurate and efficient manner.
  
• Adhering to all established branch operational processes and procedures.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
  
• High school diploma/GED required.
  
• College degree required, or a minimum of 1 year demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service in financial services or retail industry.
  
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to include professional grammar and demeanor.
  
• Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and Saturdays.
  
• Ability to travel as needed to training.
  
• Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks, and obtaining a unique identifier by the NMLS.

description:
Under the direction of the VP of Professional Development, the PD Specialist performs the general duties of coordinating core curriculum programs and delivering relevant material for instruction.  In addition, this position is responsible for demonstrating the Excellence of Dollar Banks Customer Service philosophy by participating in and practicing the disciplines and behaviors expected of an employee at the Bank.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  
•Associates Degree in Education or related field required.  Will consider commensurate experience.
  
•Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience in training or educational processes to include design, delivery and   evaluation of core curriculum programs.
  
•Excellent facilitation/presentation skills required.
  
•Experience as a back end user with Learning Management Systems and Computer Based Training preferred.
  
•Working knowledge with Powerpoint, Excel and Microsoft Word.
  
•Sales Training experience a plus.
  
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  
•Project management, time management and superior organizational skills a must.
  
•Demonstrates critical thinking skills.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  
The PD Specialist is expected to support and enhance Dollar Bank’s values and comply with Dollar Bank’s policies and procedures while instructing trainees and demonstrating the following duties:
  
•Provide quality customer service to all internal and external customers.
  
•Adhere to and teach the operational procedures that have been put in place by the bank.
  
•Provide input and evaluation on the design, development and delivery of entry level retail educational programs offered to new hires, regardless of position.
  
•Review entry level courses to ensure core curriculum programs are current and relevant.
  
•Develop and track training data for overall employee development programs.
  
•Consult with all management level personnel to identify, design, develop and/or administer specialized training for current organizational trends/needs.
  
•Manage, coordinate and deliver New Hire Orientation training where the culture is further identified and expectations are clearly explained.
  
•Works on developing advanced skills with intent of taking over teller training programs, projects and trainee’s.
  
•Develops basic understanding of each core program and is able to determine how all retail programs are related.
  
•Resolves routine questions and problems and refers more complex issues to management.

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
The purpose of this position is to support the functions of the branches and back office departments; to install, configure and support MPLS/Frame Relay environment as well as routers/switches, firewalls and the legacy and LAN multi-protocols associated with this technology; to work with internal departments to troubleshoot connectivity/networking problems; to work with outside vendors on installations and troubleshooting of problems related to network connectivity and software configuration; to respond to security updates related to network equipment and make required changes to maintain network security; to troubleshoot problems using appropriate network management tools; to configure and administrate network management tools; to administrate department servers running Windows and/or Unix; to administrate Video Conferencing system; to install, configure and support VPN appliance.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Teleprocessing environment including technical experience with voice/data networks and systems.
  
• Associate’s Degree in Information Technology or related field required. Will consider commensurate experience.
  
• Able to communicate effectively with all levels of management and outside vendors.
  
• Able to work periodic evenings and weekends.
  
• Must have good documentation and analytical skills.
  
• Should have a good working knowledge of installing and maintaining telecommunications cable plants.
  
• Experience with a variety of computer platforms ranging from mainframe (CICS and VTAM) to PC based applications preferred.
  
• Experience with a variety of networking protocols including TCP/IP, EIGRP, BGP and SSH.
  
• Knowledge of the Windows implementations of DHCP, DNS and Active Directory.
  
• Knowledge of Linux, Unix, Microsoft and Pearl shell batch scripting preferred.
  
• A vehicle and valid PA driver’s license required.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Recommend and purchase new network equipment.
  
• Recommend and install applications that will assist monitoring of the network.
  
• Install, configure and support data equipment/networks at branch offices and back office departments.
  
• Respond to all network security alerts. Including IOS upgrades and installing security patches.
  
• Make necessary firewall changes to segregate departments and provide/restrict external access to internal systems.
  
• Assign and maintain IP addressing scheme for the entire network.
  
• Make configuration changes to allow support departments to have VPN access.
  
• Troubleshoot network connectivity problems.
  
• Administrate departmental servers.
  
• Make technical presentations to upper management related to networking projects.
  
• Configure network equipment and troubleshoot network issues for annual Disaster Recovery test.

JOB FUNCTION/PURPOSE –
  

  
The Customer Relations Department is responsible for ensuring a positive, memorable customer experience to all customers as the point of contact and continuing throughout the follow-up and resolution processes. Customer Relations Specialist promptly and courteously answers all incoming phone calls. Specialists resolve customer complaints by listening to determine the cause of the problem; select and explain the best solution to solve the issue; follow-up to ensure resolution and customer satisfaction.  Specialists complete and review daily, weekly, and monthly reports ensure completion of tasks and maintain regulatory compliance.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
*High School diploma or GED required; college degree preferred in a business related field
  
*Minimum of 1 year previous Customer Service experience required
  
*1 year Mortgage Servicing or Banking experience preferred
  
*Knowledge of loan documents preferred
  
*Must be able to manage time efficiently, prioritize tasks, and coordinate multiple and changing priorities in a demanding environment
  
*Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a team setting is required
  
*Must have excellent telephone, written, and verbal communication skills
  
*Must have a sense of urgency in providing knowledgeable and prompt assistance to customers
  
*Must have strong propensity for detail, accuracy, and confidentiality
  
*Must have excellent mathematical, analytical and problem solving skills
  
*Must be professional and courteous with internal and external customers
  
*Must be able to remain calm under pressure
  
*Working knowledge of Windows and Microsoft Office applications
  
*Must be able to type accurately at 25-30 wpm

title: Customer Service Specialist

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
The Vice President of Lending establishes and manages a portfolio of high net worth clients to include various types of loans and deposits. The individual will develop and manage all aspects of the relationship. The individual will also coordinate and assess financial scenarios and act as a referral source to other asset areas of Dollar Bank. The Vice President will work with Financial Planners, Brokers, CPA’s, and Attorneys, with the objective of providing optimal solutions for the client. The individual also properly collects information and monitors credit of the client. The Private Banking Department offers its high net worth customers a broad array of services, each tailored to an individual client’s needs. These services include, but are not limited to, a variety of credit products such as commercial loans, mortgage loans and home equity loans as well as selection of deposit products such as Checking and Savings accounts, CDs, IRA as well as Money Market Accounts
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
•Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or related field required. Will consider commensurate experience. MBA preferred.
  
•Minimum of 5 years of lending experience in Private Banking or commercial lending experience required.
  
•Previous supervisory experience.
  
•Solid credit/ underwriting skills required.
  
•Solid understanding of legal and regulatory issues associated with the lending function, as well as documentation requirements is also needed.
  
•Must possess strong analytical, organizational, and customer service skills.
  
•Exceptional oral and written communication skills required.
  
•Proficiency in computer skills including Microsoft Work & Excel required.
  
•Solid understanding of collateral, valuation, perfections and liquidation is preferred.
  
•Must have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to be a team leader as well as a team player in a professional team setting.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
•Source and develop new client relationships to include loans and deposits.
  
•Gather financial information and underwrite loan reports.
  
•Put in proposal format and present to Division Head and Credit Committees for approval.
  
•Administer and maintain loan portfolio.
  
•Meet a minimum of $10 million annual loan production plus associated deposit accounts to develop solid and consistent relationships with the clients.
  
•Maintain high credit standards to ensure that the highest levels of the portfolio quality are achieved.
  
•Ensure that proper and complete loan documentation is prepared and executed, and that security conformity with loan covenants, collateral advance ratios and other conditions.
  
•As necessary, manage workouts, ensuring maximum preservation of principal for the Bank.
  
•Further develop and refer business to other asset areas of Dollar Bank to include, but not limit to: Corporate Banking, Treasury Management, Business Banking and Commercial Real Estate.
  
•Participate in professional associations and community activities to increase Dollar Bank’s visibility and enhance new business opportunities.
  

  
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
  
Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). See, hear, talk and perform tasks requiring manual dexterity and visual acuity; sit, stand, walk, crouch, reach, pull, push and other similar, repetitive tasks requiring physical activity. Able to operate standard office/computer equipment such as photocopiers, fax machines, computers, iPads, scanners, calculators, etc.
  

  
Note:
  
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

**FLSA:**  Exempt
